data.title: 3D billboards mesh shadows face light source instead of facing camera
data.body:
Hi,

Godot RC1, win64, windows8.1.

When you set the BillBoard option of a MeshInstance, the shadow is calculated with the MeshInstance facing the light source, instead of facing the active Camera.

![screencap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/5331462/fea69cfa-7e2c-11e4-9447-0ace0aa9eeeb.png)

Into this capture, the top mesh is rotated manually to face the camera. Its shadow is correct.
The bottom mesh has its Billboard option set to On. Its shadow is incorrect.

The bottom shadow should looks like the top shadow.

The light source is Directional Light with a rotation vector set to -90, 45, 90.
The camera is looking top-down.

data.title: _process not called
data.body:
```
extends Node2D
...
func _process(delta):
  print("process")
```

No output.

data.title: Make it possible to show collision shapes while running the game.
data.body:
Showing the shapes while running the game could come in handy while debugging.

Preferably with customisable display settings (color / outline) so that they could also be used to prototype games without creating assets first.

data.title: Alt+arrows editor undo/redo fix
data.body:
This is the same as PR #882 by DCubix, but I fixed it so undo/redo is supported. (I wasn't sure how to just add the fix to his PR.)

It doesn't move everything to functions, just adds the undo/redo support. Hoping it can be in 1.0 since the alt+arrows in rc1 don't work properly and don't support undo/redo at all.

data.title: member function _input is not being called "locally" in node instance
data.body:
I have several instances of a scn object which contain a control node. This control node has a script in which _input(event) is being called.

However when I print the name of the parent_node, it's always the same node regardless of instance.
The same script has an _ready() implementation. When I print the parent_node.get_name() there, it's the correct instance name.

My code is on https://github.com/Krummer/abrakadata .  the script in question would be tower_control.gd

data.title: [minor request] display current view name into editor's 3d scene viewports
data.body:
Hi,

When you edit a 3d scene, into the View menu, you can select 1,2,3 or 4 viewports.
Then, in each displayed 3d viewport, you can click the top-left [view] button to select "left view", "top view", "orthogonal", "perpective", etc.

It would be cool if instead of just [view], the currently selected view name was displayed.

For instance : [left view], [top view], [free view], or even [left ortho view], [top persp view] etc.

data.title: Typo in error message when exporting to Android
data.body: When exporting to Android I got an error message, "Could not find keytore, unable to export.". This should say, "Could not find keystore, unable to export." - note correct spelling of "keystore". This seems to be an error in line 1232 of platform/android/export/export.cpp. Nice easy one to fix ;-).

data.title: debugger line number broken by """ style comments
data.body: After a block of """ style commented lines, the debugger won't report the correct line number of an error.  Add the number of commented lines to the reported line, and that's the correct line.  If I take out the block, the line is reported correctly.

data.title: Better Collada Exporter fixes and Godot Export Manager Addition
data.body:
Hi,
I made some fixes for the Better Collada Exporter Addon for Blender.
Read the commit logs for the list of fixes.

I also created a Godot Export Manager which uses the Better Collada Exporter to export user defined groups. The user can define customized export groups with objects assigned to it. All settings will be stored in the blendfile and the groups can be exported within seconds. On the one hand a export on blendfile save can be enabled. Or it can be exported on click. As the user prefers.

data.title: Faster instance placement workflow via hotkeys and mouse/key-based selecting
data.body:
I've been using Godot for several days now, and one thing I notice is that things seem to not be optimal in terms of moving and creating large numbers of instances. Basically, I would like to see a workflow that doesn't require selection from the node tree and doesn't require the use of the manipulators (though those would still be there for people that need them.
## Rundown of a fast workflow (similar to what 3D programs do)
- Left click to select an instance and it will be highlighted in the viewport, alternatively, you should be able to press 'B' to make a box selection.
- Hotkeys for actual manipulation; 'G' for translate, 'R' for rotate, and 'S' for scale
- Use the X,Y,Z keys to constrain manipulation to an axis, alternatively, press shift beforehand to disable an axis from being used.
- Press 'ctrl' to enable snapping during a manipulation, if snapping is enabled, it disable it
- selection highlighting; Could be an outline around the object in the normal view, a changed hue for the overdraw view, or a wire re-coloring in the wire view

If these things can be implemented, it will make the workflow a lot faster in general in terms of level building (especially with large numbers of instances involved). If Godot already has something like this, then I apologize in advance.

I hope others find it a good idea.

data.title: Calling set_name() on Sprite3D crashes the game
Shader code corrupts on windows with .xscn extension.
data.body:
Probably related to this issue #912, shader itself works until stored and reopened, then the code becomes "inlined" and instead of newlines there is an invisible char.
OS: windows

data.title: Expanding animation editor leads to 'soft' crash when exiting project
data.body:
## This bug is being reported on a Win7 64 bit machine with an ATI 9xxx GPU, 16 gigs of RAM and an Ivy Bridge CPU

How to repeat.
- Open a project, any project
- Click on an animation node
- Expand the animation editor
- Menu > exit to project list

You will notice that it's not able to exit properly and instead exit by crashing, this doesn't crash you completely out of Godot though, as the console and project list window stays intact.
## In fact, the console also indicates a bug as it shows an error here 

ERROR: Free: Method/Function Failed.
Qt: server/visual/visual_server_raster.cpp:4163
## freed code id 10

If a developer can take a look at it, thanks.

Adam.

data.title: UV Xform in fixed material : ERROR set_custom_uniform
data.body:
Hi,
I'm currently testing godot RC1, win64, on an AMD A6-6310 APU (Radeon R4 integrated GPU) with windows 8.1.
This bug was already present in November 13 and 27 versions too.
Could be related to issue #469, #536 and/or #541.

How to reproduce : 
Create a 3d scene, add Spatial, add Quad.
Into Quad, create FixedMaterial.
Load a Diffuse texture.
Change Diffuse Tc from UV to UV Xform.

The Quad becomes all white, and the debug console keep yelling this : 
ERROR: set_custom_uniform: Index p_idx out of size (version->custom_uniform_locations.size()).
At: ./drivers/gles2/shader_gles2.h:324

with some : 
ERROR: set_custom_uniform_location: Index p_idx out of size (version->custom_uniform_locations.size()).
At: ./drivers/gles2/shader_gles2.h:331

If is set it back from UV Xform to UV, the console says : freed code id 13

data.title: Baking progress lost after closing editor
data.body: Godot GI has a nice feature for pausing and resuming light baking. Sadly the progress is lost after closing the editor. I think it can be easly tunded so it's not?

data.title: Light baking - no good quality options (suggestion)
data.body:
It's hard ( I would say impossible ) to hack to make the scene look great (sharp) with FULL baked light. It mostly overexposed, or/and with lower light (energy) or/and Energy Mult. levels it blurs out the scene:

![blurry_bl](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3727523/5295253/d7c2ea7c-7b9c-11e4-86c0-0dbee463a8fc.png)

Even after a long bake It's especially obvious in corners. 

I played with all kinds of settings for hours with no success and found that only good results are produced by combing dyn. Light with Indrect+shadows bake.

data.title: Light baking bugs
data.body:
1) Cell subdiv above 8 gives me

ERROR: resize: Condition ' !_ptrnew ' is true. returned: ERR_OUT_OF_MEMORY
   At: core/vector.h:262.

what results in Editor crash

2) Setting Plot size and Energy Mult to 1 results in baker doing nothing at all.

data.title: False camera visual interpretation with big 'fovy'
data.body:
To reproduce set camera Fovy to 100. Editor cuts it down to max value 89 and...

![camera_fovy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3727523/5294995/cb902472-7b97-11e4-8f97-c71bc3993399.png)

camera is visualy pointing UP, but views ok -> downwards.

data.title: 3D scene imported via BetterCollada sets point light energy to 8
data.body: For some reason, when importing 3D scene (*.dae) bettercollada from Blender, the point lights always turn to energy 8, what is to much overexposed. Why 8 anyway?

data.title: SConstruct imports multiprocessing, which is then never used
data.body:
Godot also failed to start building on my setup. Multiprocessing imported without failure on same system in both python2, python3 and ipython running python2.

Removed import statement and godot built without problems.

data.title: Add move_child_notify method in Node class
data.body: For tracking any changes on scene tree, which is specially useful for [behavior tree module](https://github.com/quabug/godot_behavior_tree)

data.title: Animation Player won't auto play
data.body:
Hi!.

Create root Node2D, add a sprite. Add an AnimationPlayer as a child of it, or next to it as a child of Node2D. Create a new animation. Edit the animation so it changes the sprites position over time. Edit the animation resource so that it loops. Now select the AnimationPlayer and change the play property to the animation you just created it plays automatically in the editor... so far so good, pretty nice work flow. 

BUT when you hit: test scene, the animation won't auto play. You can add a piece of code that tells the AnimPlayer to play in _ready but you shouldn't have to, i believe

data.title: Script inheriting script issues in editor
data.body:
When adding script (that is derived from other script) to node, editor will only show derived exported variables and on scene save will revert them to default values.
Example project:
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/w7439y35k0frmo5/AAAibSE7MsJIFzPAb4zlaNYaa?dl=0

data.title: option: toggle popup when debugging process exits
data.body: option: toggle popup when debugging process exits

data.title: "error(0,0)" message in fragment shader code
Kinematic collision with plane 3D
data.body: When a plane collider, exists where a kinematic body does, the kinematic body will not move.

data.title: iOS Builds Broken on OS X Yosemite
data.body:
Hey guys!

I just updated all of Godot to 1.0devel (to check how far it got) and iOS builds don't work yet. (Also have latest export templates)

My system:
Mac Mini late 2013
XCode Version 6.1 (6A1052d)
OSX Yosemite

The error is:

`ld: file not found: /Users/Pet0r/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/godot_ios-hkguktfuucibzwcgqysiofauzrej/Build/Products/Debug-iphoneos/godot_ios.app/godot_ios
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)`

**Update**: it only seems to be an issue when running (by hitting play button) when archiving it will succeed anyway.

data.title: Windows multiple joysticks support
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Renamed the issue to refer only to point 1) hereafter, since 2) has been fixed in #1359.

I got access to Windows and did some testing with several gamepads. I found these issues.

1) Only one gamepad seems to work at a time, even if you have more than one plugged in at the same time.

2) get_joy_name() always returns the same thing regardless of device, "Microsoft PC-joystick driver". This doesn't match up with what Windows reports (see screenshot).

![gamepads](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6351421/5213519/c9c44238-75dc-11e4-9f21-133966b169a4.png)

data.title: CubeMap ressource editor has a problem with side images
data.body:
Hi again,
still with November 13, window64 version.
I was trying to make a skybox using a CubeMap as ressource of an WorldEnvironnement, but there seems to be a bug with the CubeMap editor.

When I create the CubeMap ressource into the editor, I have to select left, right, top, bottom etc side images (in my attempts i use the png skybox from the platformer3d demo).

The editor seems to load them, but it does not update the drop down option buttons which all keep sayin "[Image (empty)]" except for the last one (Back side) which show [Image 512x512].

Once WorldEnvironnment is set with this cubemap, the cubemap/skybox show up into the scene editor. However, when I play the scene, the background is black. The skybox does not appear at all.

The debug console says : ERROR set_side : Condition ' p_image.empty() is true. At scene/ressources/texture.cpp:876

I tried again to set and load all the side images of the cubemap, but only the last option buttons show [Image 512x512].

I saved the cubemap as XML file to see what was wrong inside, and only the back side contains data. All other side are <nil name="side/left">  </nil>. (<---- here is supposed to be some HTML code appearing)

I hope my explanation make sense because it was difficult to me to explain ...

data.title: GridMap always visible even when set not visible
data.body:
hi again again,
Still using the November 13 version, windows 64.
GridMaps seems not to respond the Visibility parameter, neitheir into the editor nor when the scene is played.
They remain always visible, even when the parent node is set to invisible.
